result.title: Objective
result.description: To reduce barriers to accelerate the development of biomass markets in Serbia

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description: Installed capacity of incremental biomass projects, substituting fossil fuel-based heating, supported by the project

target.comment:
At least 3 MW of installed capacity support by this project fully operation by end of the project
Direct greenhouse gas emission reductions totaling 1.2 million tonnes of CO2 equivalent will be achieved over the lifetime of the investments of 20 years

result.title: Outcome 1
result.description: Improved capability of local municipalities and entrepreneurs to identify, prioritize and develop biomass investment opportunities in Serbia

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description:
1. Established Biomass Support Unit
2. Training Modules and seminars on Biomass Energy for local municipalities and entrepreneurs based upon the UNDP Municipal Biomass Guide and Guide for Investors
3. New course on Biomass Energy at the University of Belgrade & Novi Sad
4. Public awareness raising campaign on Biomass Energy
4.1 Annual International workshop
5.Support to development of the biomass market
5.1 Biomass e-trade platform

baseline.comment:
1. No Biomass Support Unit
2. No training or study courses on Biomass to Energy issues
3. No guidance in development of biomass projects or previous experience
4. Currently no university training or study courses on Biomass to Energy issues
5. Limited awareness about climate change issues
6. No biomass e-trading platform

target.comment:
1. Biomass Support Unit staffed and in full operation with funding to continue after project ends
2. At least 12 completed regional seminars on biomass energy that employed the designed training module will be presented
3. Established courses on biomass at Universities Belgrade and Novi Sad
Regularly organized and conducted Annual International Workshop on Biomass Energy in Serbia produced by the Biomass Support Unit
Biomass e-trading platform operational

actual.comment:
1. Inter-institutional Biomass Support Unit has been established within the Ministry of Mining and Energy, staffed and in full operation.
2. No training modules and seminars on Biomass Energy for local municipalities and entrepreneurs (planned for 2016/2017)
3. No new course on biomass energy at the University of Belgrade and Novi Sad (planned for 2016/2017)
4. Public awareness raising campaign on biomass energy initiated
4.1. International conference 'Sustainable Growth from Biomass' was organized on 26 March, 2015 in the Serbian Chamber of Commerce and Industry in cooperation with Finnish Embassy in Serbia and Standing Conference of Towns and Municipalities.
4.2. Project web site has been established (http://biomasa.undp.org.rs).
5. Grant Agreement for non-credit related activities was signed between the UNDP and Serbian Chamber of Commerce and Industry for the Project "Development and Operation of the Biomass Web Portal along with the Online Biomass Trading Platform and Biomass e-trading Platform" in June 2015.

result.title: Outcome 2
result.description: Stronger and more effective secondary legislation related to biomass energy is developed and approved and adopted

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description:
1. Status of adoption of secondary legislation, technical standards, policies and regulations for biomass projects and biomass supply including required amendments to existing bylaws, technical standards and technical regulations for energy/power facilities.
2. Established licensing procedures

baseline.comment:
1. No secondary legislation, technical standards, policies and regulations for biomass projects and biomass supply including required amendments to existing bylaws, technical standards and technical regulations for energy/power facilities.
2. Lack of integrated licensing procedures

target.comment:
1. Proposed secondary legislation, technical standards, policies and regulations for biomass projects and biomass supply including required amendments to existing bylaws, technical standards and technical regulations for energy/power facilities
2. Appropriate licensing procedures; biomass to energy systems are in place and investors have clarified and simplified process to follow

actual.comment:
1. Elaboration of the new Government decrees in line with recently adopted new Energy law is in course:
1.1 The Decree on Incentives for Privileged Power Producers which will prescribe in more detail the categories of privileged power producers, incentives, conditions for their achievement, manner of setting the incentive period, rights and obligations derived from the incentives for privileged power producers and other energy entities, set the content of relevant contracts etc. is in course.
1.2 The Decree on Conditions and Procedure for Acquiring the Status of Privileged Electricity Producer
1.3 The Decree on on Setting the Models of Power Purchase Agreements and Pre-Agreements
1.4 The Decree on Guarantee of Origin for Electricity Produced from Renewable Energy Sources
The above listed decrees are of decisive significance for use of biomass, and renewable energy in general.
1.5 Project partner institution - Institute for Standardization (ISS) has started activities on the GEF Project in May 2015. European Standard EN 16325 has been translated. Process of its adoption by technical commission A242 of ISS has been initiated. It will provide basis for Decree on Guarantee of Origin for Electricity Produced from Renewable Energy Sources which is to be adopted by the Government of RS to complement recently adopted Energy Law. Elaboration of the said Decree is in course.
2. No Licensing procedure established (planned for 2016/2017)

result.title: Outcome 3
result.description: Successfully operating Biomass Support Unit which leads to increased capability of municipalities and entrepreneurs in Serbia to develop, finance, construct, and operate bankable biomass energy projects

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description:
1. Availability of National Programme for bio energy development in Serbia
2. Number of training seminars for banks and project developers
3. Status of Investment Grant Mechanism

baseline.comment:
1. No long-term National Programme for bio energy sector in Serbia
2. No dedicated training
3. Lack of knowledge about biomass projects among local banks and project developers
No Investment Grant mechanism

target.comment:
1. National Bio energy Strategy and Action Plan, which reflects broad stakeholder consensus, prepared for adoption by the Government of Serbia.
2. At least 10 completed training seminars by the Biomass Support Unit for Serbian banks and Serbian project developers regarding biomass to energy projects.
3. Operational criteria agreed with relevant stakeholders and investment grants released

actual.comment:
1. No National Programme for bio energy (planned for 2016)
2. No training seminars for banks and project developers (planned for 2016)
3. Elaborate investment grant mechanism prepared by Biomass Support Unit (BSU) and agreed with the Ministry of Mining and Energy and project partners.
Public call for investors in biomass/biogas fired CHP facilities along with model contract and application form has been elaborated by the BSU.
Public call or investors in biomass/biogas fired CHP facilities was published in May 2015.

result.title: Outcome 4
result.description:
Six biomass projects are successfully financed, constructed and operating by the end of the project
Technical viability of specific biomass technologies is demonstrated as the basis for replication

baseline.comment:
1. No investment grant support mechanism
2. No bio energy projects, insufficient capacities

target.comment:
1. Investment grant mechanism established and successfully piloted by the end of the project
2. Biomass projects of at least 4MW installed capacity (in total) are successfully financed, constructed and operating by the end of the Project

actual.comment:
1. Investment grant mechanism established. Its implementation is in course
2. No biomass projects (planed for 2016)

result.title: Outcome 5
result.description: At least 12 additional Biomass Projects are being supported by the Biomass Support Unit / Investment Grant Mechanism by the end of the Project

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description:
1. Number of new bio energy projects initiated in Serbia
2. Case Study or Documentary film on biomass

baseline.comment:
1. No bio energy projects, insufficient capacities
2. No recent films covering full supply to delivery chains

target.comment:
1. At least 12 pre-feasibility for the new bio energy projects elaborated by the end of the Project.
2. One film covering all the projects established during the project

actual.comment:
1. No new bioenergy projects
2. No Case Study Documentary film on biomass
